gnlziFQlLyUgt19yJV3wjA.text: This place rules! Arrived to Edinburgh late and felt discouraged by the late night food options... Civerinos to the rescue! Great pizza, great staff, great ambiance, great branding, great playlist. Get it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Civerinos - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Civerinos - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

D892HpuvcpqS_ZzdXlxVJA.text: Civerinos is the coolest pizza joint in Edinburgh, with striking similarities to privately owned pizzerias in America, both atmosphere and taste. I love their motto branded on every cup and menu, "Death before Dominos," both because it suggests an eatery that goes above the norm, and because I despise mediocre Domino's Pizza just as much as they do.  American rock and hip hop music sets the mood, the huge wood-fired oven swallows up giant circles of dough with masterful creations one after the next, and an almost psychedelic decor is complemented by youthful, hip workers, some tossing dough high in the air.  The slices are enormous and one will suffice for most people (or three for champion eaters like me). Unlike many pizza places, you can order any style of pizza by the slice as long as it's listed on the menu. The combinations of ingredients are extremely clever, the sugo red sauce is good, and the crust is even better.  My wife and I tried The Civerinos, with toppings combining flavorful clumps of Sicilian sausage, delicious thick slices of pepperoni, an abundance of rosemary, and melted mozzarella. These slices were ultimately topped with cold burrata, a milky fresh mozzarella mixed with cream which added another dimension of texture and temperature. We also tried the Civernos fries which were heavily spiced the way I like it and covered with cheese.  Locals rate the pizzeria a 5, but I can't go that far. I know what a 5 is in the world of pizza, like Frank Pepe's in New Haven or Lombardi's in Little Italy. Civernos is no 5, it's more like a 3.9, but it's very good. And for Americans it's close to home.  I think only two things stand between a 4-star rating and a 5-star rating. First, Americans are accustomed to much more red sauce and there just wasn't enough to complement the ingredients. But I understand that light quantities of sauce is a European thing.  Second, the quality of the mozzarella was not good. At the best pizzerias in Italy and America, you can really taste the cheese as it holds together all the ingredients with a delicious quality! At Civerinos, it was more like grated tasteless tofu, failing to add anything to the flavor. That was extremely obvious on the loaded fries, with strings of tasteless mozzarella when closely examined. But no doubt, you'll get a good slice of pizza here and I'd recommend it.

x9ZPtX_wngyF3JtlqELhZg.text: Super thin crust, wood fired pizza that melts in your mouth! The Civerinos special with burrata on top made it perfect

photos.caption: Photo of Civerinos - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

tCHkZLSJ-CHWYhEBR_TEcw.text: Civerinos - a solid place to get an oversized slice of creative pizza in a casual, cool atmosphere, much hyped among Uni students.   This is a great pizza place! Wait staff is super nice, pizza is great, and it's a good vibe. I'm not sure if it's up to all the hype that I've heard about it, but it's very good! Have gone here once for slices, and also gotten delivery.   First off - they have vegan pizza!! Awesome. My vegan friend had a slice and liked it. I tried the Civerinos - a delicious pepperoni/burrata rendition, as well as the Veggie As - a sweeter beet + chevre + rocket with a drizzle of balsamic - which I liked just as much as the civerinos. Put together with a beer (wish they had more selection!) and it made for a great meal. Definitely will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Civerinos - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Civerino&#39;s! Note the delicious helping of burrata.

6ygJ4l9mG2sr1dVEihrprQ.text: Delicious pizza - and boozy slushies on a quaint square. Great spot for an afternoon snack after roaming Old Town.

xxsKewjZJOHbAHxOS3eOLg.text: NYC style pizza in Scotland! Very hipster place with a young crowd. You can order slices of pizza or a whole pie. The whole pie is huge and can serve about 3 very hungry people. We got the Civerinos whole pie and it was delicious. Crust was the right thickness, just enough sauce and cheese, and the toppings were great. Comes with Parmesan and chili flakes if you ask. We also ordered beers which accompanied the pizza well.

photos.caption: Photo of Civerinos - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Civerinos - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1iLZuZh0ZMndsEFIaZAO0A.text: Finally, True American/New York style pizza in the UK. The slices were better than any others we've had around here. Note: My 5-star rating is scaled for the UK market.

6hHkNJelCvar9osEJynQ8g.text: Excellent pizza options. I had the Tommy Boy and it was flavorful and just the right amount of spicy. Service was on point as well which is critical for me, even more than the food. The server was attentive even with several large parties in the joint. Also, because I ordered a second slice, they were in process of making new pie. Instead of me just waiting, the cook came over and told me it would be about 8 minutes. It's little stuff like that that makes the difference.

RTnBOF3GML6gVuVIswkTKQ.text: You may feel you're not hip enough to eat here but that's okay as takeaway's an option.   20" pizzas offer the best value rather than by the slice so not ideal for a solo visit unless you're very hungry.  Prepared to be proved wrong but there didn't appear to be a really spicy option on the menu; what is there offers a good range of flavours, although we had trouble working out which half of our order was the margarita & which the one with 6 cheeses on it.  Service was good and friendly and the decor reflects stickering & skate culture (be sure to cop a sticker or two at the end of your visit). The music was pretty decent although a bit more work could probably go into the playlist(s) as there was some repetition. I found it odd too that the soft drink selection was rather generic i.e. Coca Cola rather than something sexier/less morally suspect.

2_291zeaf1t3Cl3LKCAt5w.text: We love Civerinos and Civerinos Slice is even better! Being able to order pizza by the slice is great when you're married to a less adventurous eater and the polar pear is my favorite.

oecbKe0AMaL9HwFEm-rx5A.text: New York style pizza, by the slice or whole pizza.  Lovely pizza. Freshly cooked. Does what it says on the tin.

amkCSdjTsUphBLLDY8IRxw.text: Great new place, only open 5 days. Got pepperoni, Porky's Revenge, and the Parmesana, all three were excellent. Friendly staff, great decor. Fabulous ceiling, don't forget to look up. The place was packed and we still got our pizzas very quickly. Quirky vibe and music were great. Also sells by the slice.

mvuaUVSiTn2S2c4sfxC6IA.text: Yummy pizza!! Great prices, good music -- the staff is friendly and kind. Be sure to get your pizza here!
